alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 9:01PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Franklin, Stephens, Habersham, west central Anderson and southern Oconee Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 900 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Clarkesville to 5 miles southwest of Seneca. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Clarkesville, Seneca, Westminster, Gumlog, Demorest, Avalon, Tugaloo State Park, Tallulah Falls and Lake Hartwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
